comment: # The barrier is complete. With the Knight on g6 covering the pawn on f4 and Rook on h8, with the King on b7 or c7, the Bishop on c6 covering Bxd5 and the Rook free to move to d8 to stop Qd6+, White has no way through without sacrifising a piece. The only remaining problem is to convince White he can't win.
reasoning: The comment accurately describes the mistake made by the player, highlighting the lack of escape routes for White and the necessity to convince them they cannot win.
